## packages
```{r, message = FALSE}
library(tidyverse) #for data cleaning
```

## read in the data
```{r}
car_raw <- read_csv("car_data.csv")
head(car_raw)
```
## summary statistics
```{r}
summary(car_raw)
```

## are there any NA values?

```{r}
sum(is.na(car_raw))
```

## converting variables to appropriate formats
```{r}
## converting variables to appropriate formats
## the below code converts the 'v_gender' and 'Blink_or_Honk' variables from numeric to binary
## and the 'CarColor' variable from numeric to a factor

car_raw <- car_raw %>% 
  mutate(v_gender = as.logical(v_gender),
         Blink_or_Honk = as.logical(Blink_or_Honk),
         CarColor = as.factor(CarColor))
```

## let's look at the distributions of the variables
```{r}
hist(car_raw$RespTimeSeconds)
hist(car_raw$CarColor)

#
ggplot(car_raw, aes(x = CarColor)) +
  geom_histogram(stat = "count")
## group sizes look equal
table(car_raw$CarColor)
```
